meanings.definition: A record or statement of financial transactions
meanings.sent1: I keep track of my expenses in my account book.
meanings.sent2: The accountant prepared the company's financial accounts.
meanings.sent3: My piggy bank demanded an account of all the coins I put in.
meanings.sent4: Her savings account told a story of discipline and thrift.
meanings.sent5: The bank manager reviewed the accounts with a keen eye.

meanings.sent1: Taking your feelings into account, I will be more careful next time.
meanings.sent2: She held his opinion in high account.
meanings.sent3: In the grand scheme of things, his opinion didn't hold much account.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness towards others is of great account in our community.
meanings.sent5: The teacher took his effort into account when grading the assignment.

meanings.definition: To give a report or explanation
meanings.sent1: I will account for my absence from the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He had to account for the missing funds.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to account for the knocked-over vase, but no one believed her.
meanings.sent4: She had to account for her actions to her parents.
meanings.sent5: The detective asked him to account for his whereabouts during the crime.
